page.title: 14BUILDINGS IN DUNURE (2)
page.content: North of harbour is Dunure House,early 19th Century two storey building,bow frontage with grey roughcast finish. Sits in own grounds and is "B" Grade Listed.The Kennedy Hall was build in 1881 and donated to the village people by the Laird Colonel Kennedy.It was first used as a Reading Room then a Recreation Centre.The Hall is now used by many local organisations.Dunure Castle,13th Century,is ancient fortress of Kennedys (Earls of Casillis).It stands on rocky promontory above sea.Now a ruin but basement vaults more or less intact. Close to Castle stands well preserved "Beehive" style dovecote.Castle and dovecote are "A" Listed Buildings.On hill above school adjacent to farm of same name is Dunduff Castle,a square keep,building of which was reputed never to have been completed.
